checker_log_all_failures.description: Log every failed real server check in syslog

vrrp_garp_master_delay.description: Delay for second set of gratuitous ARPs after transition to MASTER in seconds. (default: 5)

vrrp_garp_master_repeat.description: Number of gratuitous ARP messages to send at a time after transition to MASTER. (default: 5)

vrrp_garp_lower_prio_delay.description: Delay for second set of gratuitous ARPs after lower priority advert received when MASTER. (default: vrrp_garp_master_delay)

vrrp_garp_lower_prio_repeat.description: Number of gratuitous ARP messages to send at a time after lower priority advert received when MASTER. (default: vrrp_garp_master_repeat)

vrrp_garp_master_refresh.description: Minimum time interval for refreshing gratuitous ARPs while MASTER. in seconds (resolution seconds). (default: vrrp_garp_master_repeat)

vrrp_garp_master_refresh_repeat.description: number of gratuitous ARP messages to send at a time while MASTER. (default: 1)

vrrp_garp_interval.description: Delay between gratuitous ARP messages sent on an interface. decimal, seconds (resolution usecs). (default: 0)

vrrp_gna_interval.description: Delay between unsolicited NA messages sent on an interface. decimal, seconds (resolution usecs). (default: 0)

vrrp_min_garp.description: By default keepalived sends 5 gratuitions ARP/NA messages at a time, and after transitioning to MASTER sends a second block of 5 messages 5 seconds later. With modern switches this is unnecessary, so setting vrrp_min_garp causes only one ARP/NA message to be sent, with no repeat 5 seconds later.

vrrp_garp_extra_if_all.description: The following option causes periodic GARP/NA messages to be sent on interfaces of VIPs/eVIPs that are not the interface of the VRRP instance, in order to ensure that switch MAC caches are maintained (specified in seconds).

vrrp_garp_extra_if_interval.description: The following option causes periodic GARP/NA messages to be sent on interfaces of VIPs/eVIPs that are not the interface of the VRRP instance, in order to ensure that switch MAC caches are maintained (specified in seconds).

vrrp_lower_prio_no_advert.description: If a lower priority advert is received, don't send another advert. This causes adherence to the RFCs. Defaults to false, unless strict_mode is set.

vrrp_higher_prio_send_advert.description: If we are master and receive a higher priority advert, send an advert (which will be lower priority than the other master), before we transition to backup. This means that if the other master has garp_lower_priority_repeat set, it will resend garp messages.

vrrp_version.description: Set the default VRRP version to use (default: 2, but IPv6 instances will use version 3)
